intro: Pholidota undulata, commonly known as the wavy pholidota, is a species of flowering plant native to certain regions of Asia. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae, which includes many plants with unique floral structures. The plant is characterized by its wavy, undulating leaves that give it its common name. It produces small, inconspicuous flowers that are often clustered in inflorescences. The plant is adapted to grow in moist, shaded environments and is sometimes used in traditional medicine.
